description:
Jozin z Bazin Dance Quest TVC by FeCO

Written for Basic10liner competition, category: "Extreme 256"

Computer: VideoTON TV-Computer 64K+ (TVC), Basic 2.2

Recommended emulator: WinTVC

 

INTRODUCTION 

 ************* 

 You know Jozin z Bazin song from Ivan Mladek band, dont you? For those who missed it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FuOhQZP821o

This is dance quest: I show and you repeat the dance movement from the clip.

You have to wait a while after start the game, then a beep, and border switching to blue - you can check/learn the key control functions (press 0-9) you can press the keys 20 times. After that the border switch to purple: you have to learn the move (one step increase in every cycle). Then border switch back to grey, any its your turn: press the numbers to reproduce the dance. If you failed border will be red, if it was OK, border will switch to green. If the steps finished the game restarts from training.

 

 

If you arent familiar with the VideoTON TVC Computers, you are not alone. This computer built and sold mostly in Hungary, Europe. The category between the ZX-Spectrum or  Amstrad CPC and between Enterprise 128 (lets say: the successor). 32, and 64k Memory, Z80 processor and 16 (hmm actually 15) color. It has four expansion slots, which makes it unique and quite expandable. You can find more information at www.tvc.hu, and you should use google translator i guess.

PROGRAM LINES OVERVIEW

************************

I have to use constants to reduce the size of the lines, these were on the begin and on the end of the lines usually.

1-7: phases of the dance

5: d$ = dance data

7/2: training (20 key press)

8: "listen and repeat"

9: Restart or show the movement

10: Dance Data/player/quit option
